Package net.ontopia.topicmaps.nav.taglibs.template

Provides templating tags which enable the separation of presentation and content, or to use the terminology of the Navigator, the Model from the View.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
AbstractTemplateTag INTERNAL: Code-sharing abstract superclass for GetTag and PutTag.
GetTag INTERNAL: Gets a string for use in a JSP template (view) via a key defined in a "put" tag on the original JSP (model).
InsertTag INTERNAL: Defines the template JSP to forward the request to, once all of the PutTag strings have been stored.
PageParameter INTERNAL: Data carrier class used to pass data between tags.
PutTag INTERNAL: Labels a string on a JSP content (model) page which can be used by GetTag for use on a template (view) page.
SplitTag INTERNAL: Tag used to indicate where a nested template is to be split.
 

Package net.ontopia.topicmaps.nav.taglibs.template Description

Provides templating tags which enable the separation of presentation and content, or to use the terminology of the Navigator, the Model from the View. These tags will be useful for information designers who can "put" data into named string blocks, as well as graphic designers, who are able to "get" these strings and place them into html templates.

See http://www.javaworld.com/javaworld/jw-09-2000/jw-0915-jspweb_p.html for an article on the use of templates.
